com.google.android.exoplayer2

Class MediaPeriodInfoSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer2.MediaPeriodInfoSequence

  • final class MediaPeriodInfoSequence
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a sequence of MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfos to the player, determining the order and start/end positions for MediaPeriods to load and play.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo
      Stores the information required to load and play a MediaPeriod.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Timeline.Period period 
      private int repeatMode 
      private boolean shuffleModeEnabled 
      private Timeline timeline 
      private Timeline.Window window 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MediaPeriodInfoSequence()
      Creates a new media period info sequence.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getFirstMediaPeriodInfo(PlaybackInfo playbackInfo)
      Returns the first MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo to play, based on the specified playback position.
      private MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getMediaPeriodInfo(MediaSource.MediaPeriodId id, long contentPositionUs, long startPositionUs)

      private MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getMediaPeriodInfoForContent(int periodIndex, long startPositionUs, long endUs) 
      MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getNextMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo currentMediaPeriodInfo, long rendererOffsetUs, long rendererPositionUs)
      Returns the MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo following currentMediaPeriodInfo.
      MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo mediaPeriodInfo)
      Returns the mediaPeriodInfo updated to take into account the current timeline.
      MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo mediaPeriodInfo, int newPeriodIndex)
      Returns the mediaPeriodInfo updated to take into account the current timeline, resetting the identifier of the media period to the specified newPeriodIndex.

      private boolean isLastInPeriod(MediaSource.MediaPeriodId id, long endPositionUs) 
      private boolean isLastInTimeline(MediaSource.MediaPeriodId id, boolean isLastMediaPeriodInPeriod) 
      MediaSource.MediaPeriodId resolvePeriodPositionForAds(int periodIndex, long positionUs)
      Resolves the specified timeline period and position to a MediaSource.MediaPeriodId that should be played, returning an identifier for an ad group if one needs to be played before the specified position, or an identifier for a content media period if not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaPeriodInfoSequence

        public MediaPeriodInfoSequence()
        Creates a new media period info sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeline

        public void setTimeline(Timeline timeline)
        Sets the Timeline. Call getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(com.google.android.exoplayer2.MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo) to update period information taking into account the new timeline.

      • setRepeatMode

        public void setRepeatMode(int repeatMode)
        Sets the Player.RepeatMode. Call getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(com.google.android.exoplayer2.MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo) to update period information taking into account the new repeat mode.

      • setShuffleModeEnabled

        public void setShuffleModeEnabled(boolean shuffleModeEnabled)
        Sets whether shuffling is enabled. Call getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(com.google.android.exoplayer2.MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo) to update period information taking into account the shuffle mode.

      • getFirstMediaPeriodInfo

        public MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getFirstMediaPeriodInfo(PlaybackInfo playbackInfo)
        Returns the first MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo to play, based on the specified playback position.

      • getNextMediaPeriodInfo

        public MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getNextMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo currentMediaPeriodInfo,
                                                                      long rendererOffsetUs,
                                                                      long rendererPositionUs)
        Returns the MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo following currentMediaPeriodInfo.
        Parameters:
        currentMediaPeriodInfo - The current media period info.
        rendererOffsetUs - The current renderer offset in microseconds.
        rendererPositionUs - The current renderer position in microseconds.
        Returns:
        The following media period info, or null if it is not yet possible to get the next media period info.

      • resolvePeriodPositionForAds

        public MediaSource.MediaPeriodId resolvePeriodPositionForAds(int periodIndex,
                                                             long positionUs)
        Resolves the specified timeline period and position to a MediaSource.MediaPeriodId that should be played, returning an identifier for an ad group if one needs to be played before the specified position, or an identifier for a content media period if not.

      • getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo

        public MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo mediaPeriodInfo)
        Returns the mediaPeriodInfo updated to take into account the current timeline.

      • getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo

        public MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo mediaPeriodInfo,
                                                                         int newPeriodIndex)
        Returns the mediaPeriodInfo updated to take into account the current timeline, resetting the identifier of the media period to the specified newPeriodIndex.

      • getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo

        private MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo getUpdatedMediaPeriodInfo(MediaPeriodInfoSequence.MediaPeriodInfo info,
                                                                          MediaSource.MediaPeriodId newId)

      • getMediaPeriodInfo
